p: This disease occurs in 12 countries in Latin America, 90% of cases occurring in Brazil, especially in the Northeast region. In the country, the disease is found throughout the Brazilian territory except for the Southern region. Over the last 10 years, the annual average is of 3,156 cases, with an incidence of 2/100,000 cases per inhabitant. It is most common in children under 10 years old, and proportionally males are most affected ( 2).
